New Roster (Age of Sigmar) [4,540pts]

  • **Pitched Battle** (Death: Tomb Kings (Warscroll Compendium)) [4,540pts]

    Rules: At the Double, Forward to Victory, Inspiring Presence

    • Leader [2,000pts]

      • Casket of Souls [160pts]

        Selections: 3. Blade of Dark Summons, 4. Master of the Black Arts, General

        Categories: DEATH, TOMB KINGS, MORTUARY PRIESTHOOD, HERO, PRIEST, CASKET OF SOULS, Leader, Behemoth, Artefact, General

        Artefact: Blade of Dark Summons, Command Trait: Master of the Black Arts, Unit: Casket of Souls, Unit Abilities: Casket, Covenant of Power, Keeper's Scrolls, Unleashed Souls, Weapon: Casket Guards' Double-handed Swords, Keeper's Mortuary Dagger and Glaive


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        Blade of Dark Summons Once per battle, in your hero phase, you can set up a SUMMONABLE DEATH unit wholly within 12" of the bearer and more than 3" from any enemy models, and add it to your army. The models in the unit must have a combined Wounds characteristic of no more than a 2D6 roll.
        Command Trait Command Trait Details Ref
        Master of the Black Arts This general is a WIZARD who knows the Arcane Bolt and Mystic Shield spells. If this general is already a wizard, add 1 to all of their casting and unbinding rolls instead.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Casket of Souls 2"8104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Casket This model cannot make charge moves. However, you can add 1 to all save rolls for this model in the shooting phase.
        Covenant of Power While a LICHE PRIEST from your army is within 18" of this model, add 1 to their casting rolls.
        Keeper's Scrolls The Keeper can attempt to unbind one spell in the enemy hero phase as if he were a wizard.
        Unleashed Souls In your hero phase you can declare that the Keeper of the Casket will unleash the tortured souls of the damned. If you do so, pick a visible enemy unit within 20" and roll a dice. On a 3+ that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds (if its Bravery is 4 or less it su ers D6 mortal wounds instead). Then roll a dice for each other enemy unit within 6" of the first unit. On a 5+ that unit is also attacked by the vengeful souls, and suffers D3 mortal wounds (if its Bravery is 4 or less it suffers D6 mortal wounds instead).
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Casket Guards' Double-handed Swords Melee1"44+3+-11
        Keeper's Mortuary Dagger and Glaive Melee1"14+3+-1D3

        • Skeletal Steed

          Unit Abilities: Skeletal Steed, Weapon: Steed's Thundering Hooves


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        Black Amulet Once per battle, in your hero phase, the bearer can use this amulet. If it does so, pick an enemy unit within 12" of the bearer. Inflict a number of mortal wounds equal to the number of the current battle round on the unit you picked.
        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Liche Priest 1/1Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield and Righteous Smiting
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Righteous Smiting 5If successfully cast, pick a Desert Legions or Reanimant unit within 18". Until your next hero phase, all models in the unit are imbued with magical power; each time you roll a hit roll of 6+ for a model in this unit, make one additional hit roll for the same weapon at the same target.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Liche Priest (Skeletal Steed) 12"5106+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Hierophant's Scrolls Once per game, when a Liche Priest attempts to unbind a spell, he can read from his ancient scrolls; if he does, that unbinding attempt is automatically successful.
        Skeletal Steed A Liche Priest can ride a skeletal steed. If he does so, his Move is increased to 12" and he gains the undering Hooves attack..

In any of your movement phases, you can set it up on the battlefield more than 9" from any enemy models. This counts as this models move for that movement phase.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Scarab Prince This model heals one wound in each of your hero phases. If this model is slain, before it is removed it can immediately make a Tide of Scuttling Scarabs attack as if it were the shooting phase.

      • Tomb Herald [100pts]

        Selections: 6. Ring of Immortality, On Foot

        Categories: DEATH, TOMB KINGS, SKELETON, DESERT LEGIONS, HERO, TOTEM, TOMB HERALD, Leader, Artefact

        Artefact: Ring of Immortality, Unit: Tomb Herald, Unit Abilities: Standard of the Undying Legion, Sworn Bodyguard, Weapon: Ancient Blade


        Artefact Artefact Details Ref
        Ring of Immortality The first time the bearer is slain, before removing them from the battlefield, roll a dice. On a 3+ the bearer is not slain and D3 wounds allocated to them are healed (any excess damage is negated). Then, remove the bearer from the battlefield and set them up again within 18" of their original location and more than 3" from any enemy models.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Tomb Herald 4"5104+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Standard of the Undying Legion This unit carries the Standard of the Undying Legion. In your hero phase, a Tomb Herald can plant his standard and cause fallen warriors to return to the ght once more. If he does so, you may not move the Tomb Herald until your next hero phase, but you can immediately return 1 slain model to each friendly DESERT LEGIONS unit within 24".
        Sworn Bodyguard If a friendly EMBALMED model from your army is allocated a wound or mortal wound while within 3" of this model, the Tomb Herald can leap in front of the attack. Roll a dice for each wound or mortal wound. On a 2+ that wound or mortal wound is allocated to the Tomb Herald instead.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Ancient Blade Melee1"43+3+-11

If a DESERT LEGIONS unit is affected by this ability, you can also add 1 to their wound rolls in the combat phase.

If he does so, pick a DESERT LEGIONS unit within 18" and roll a dice; on a roll of 1 this model suffers a mortal wound. On a roll of 2+ the incantation is successfully carried out – the chosen unit’s Move characteristic is doubled and it can fly for the duration of your next movement phase.

Note that a unit can only be affected by each of the following command abilities once per battle round: ‘And He Did Say ‘War’, and the World Did Tremble...’, ‘Blessing of Accuracy’, ‘My Will Be Done’ and ‘Who Dares Disturb My Slumber?’

        Arcing Skulls This war machine can shoot at targets that are not visible to it.
        Crewed War Machine A Screaming Skull Catapult can only move if its CREW are within 1" at the start of the movement phase. If its CREW are within 1" of the catapult in the shooting phase, they can fire the war machine. The war machine cannot make charge moves, does not need to take battleshock tests and is unaffected by any attack or ability that uses Bravery. The CREW are in cover while they are within 1" of their war machine.
        Deathless Overseer You can fire Screaming Skulls an additional time in your shooting phase if there are any friendly Necrotects within 1" of the war machine.
        Screaming Amunition A unit that suffers any wounds from Screaming Skulls must subtract 2 from its Bravery characteristic until the end of the turn.

      • Carrion [80pts]

        Selections: 3 Carrion

        Categories: DEATH, TOMB KINGS, CARRION, Other

        Unit: Carrion, Unit Abilities: Circling High Above, Fly, Scavenger's Dive, Weapon: Rotting Talons and Sharp Beaks


        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Carrion 12"3106+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Circling High Above When first set up, units of Carrion are assumed to be flying high above the battle eld. As long as they remain high in the sky, they cannot be charged, attacked, targeted by spells or a ected by abilities used by either side, and they also cannot make any attacks themselves as they soar far above their foes. Other units ignore the Carrion as they move (they move underneath them).
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Scavenger's Dive The first time this unit declares a charge, you can roll 3 dice rather than 2 to see how far it charges (when doing so, you can declare a charge if it is within 18" of the enemy, rather than 12"). As they charge, the Carrion are assumed to drop down to low level, and the Circling High Above ability no longer applies to the unit for the rest of the battle.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Rotting Talons and Sharp Beaks Melee1"44+3+-1

      • Sepulchral Stalkers [140pts]

        Selections: 3 Sepulchral Stalkers

        Categories: DEATH, TOMB KINGS, REANIMANT, SEPULCHRAL STALKERS, Other

        Battalion Abilities: Sepulchral Stalkers, Unit Abilities: Transmogrifying Gaze, Underground Stalkers, Weapon: Ornate Stave, Transmogrifying Gaze


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        Sepulchral Stalkers
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Transmogrifying Gaze When this unit makes a Transmogrifying Gaze attack, choose an enemy unit within 10". Roll a dice for each model in the attacking unit; for each roll of 1, a Sepulchral Stalker has caught a glimpse of its own reflection and the attacking unit suffers 1 mortal wound. On a 2 or 3 the target unit keeps its eyes shut and nothing happens. On a 4 or 5 the target unit suffers 1 mortal wound as it briefly meets the Stalker’s gaze, but on a 6 it suffers D3 mortal wounds as it foolishly stares into the Stalker's eyes and crumbles to sand.
        Underground Stalkers Instead of setting up a unit of Sepulchral Stalkers on the battlefield, you can place them to one side and say that they are set up beneath the ground. In any of your movement phases, you can set the unit up on the battlefield more than 9" from any enemy models. This is the unit’s move for that movement phase. The Sepulchral Stalkers can burrow back underground in any of your future movement phases. If they do, remove the unit from the battlefield – it can return in a later turn as described above.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Ornate Stave Melee2"24+3+-12
        Transmogrifying Gaze Missile10"*****

    • Malign Sorcery [80pts]

      • Endless Spell: Aethervoid Pendulum [50pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, AETHERVOID PENDULUM, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Aethervoid Pendulum, Unit Abilities: Fly, Predatory, Scything Blade, Slicing Into Reality, Unstoppable Mechanism


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Aethervoid Pendulum 6If successfully cast, set up an Aethervoid Pendulum model wholly within 6" of the caster so that it points lengthways in the direction you wish it to move.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Predatory An Aethervoid Pendulum is a predatory endless spell. It can move up to 8" and can fly.
        Scything Blade After this model has moved, each unit that has any models it passed across, and each other unit that is within 1" of it at the end of its move, suffers D6 mortal wounds.
        Slicing Into Reality When this model is set up, the player who set it up can immediately make a move with it.
        Unstoppable Mechanism Whenever you set up an Aethervoid Pendulum, you must place it lengthways in the direction you wish it to move. Whenever it moves, move it in a straight line in that direction.

      • Endless Spell: Prismatic Palisade [30pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, HYSH, PRISMATIC PALISADE, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Prismatic Palisade, Unit Abilities: Blinding Light, Dazzling Brilliance, Empowered by Hysh


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Prismatic Palisade 5If successfully cast, set up a Prismatic Palisade model wholly within 18" of the caster.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Blinding Light At the start of each turn, roll a dice for each unit within 6" of this model. On a 5+ subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks made by that unit until the end of the turn.
        Dazzling Brilliance A model cannot see another model if an imaginary straight line, 1mm wide, drawn from the centre of its base to the centre of the other model’s base passes over this model.
        Empowered by Hysh If your battle is taking place in the Realm of Light, add 1 to rolls made to determine if a unit is affected by this model’s Blinding Light ability.

Force Rules

At the Double: You can use this command ability after you make a run roll for a friendly unit that is within 6" of a friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. If you do so, the run roll is treated as being a 6. (Core Rules p3)

Forward to Victory: You can use this command ability after you make a charge roll for a friendly unit that is within 6" of a friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. If you do so, re-roll the charge roll. (Core Rules p3)

Inspiring Presence: You can use this command ability at the start of the battleshock phase. If you do so, pick a friendly unit that is within 6" of friendly HERO, or 12" of a friendly HERO that is a general. That unit does not have to take battleshock tests in that phase. (Core Rules p3)
